result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Bradley J Grisham was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MA]Case called at 1:27pm
Defendant Bradley J Grisham appears via video conferencing from Oshkosh Correctional, in custody. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

The Court verifies receipt of Mr. Grisham's petition; and DA objection
The Court inquires of Mr. Grisham treatment that he has undergone/ programs he has participated in while incarcerated

Given Mr. Grisham's explanation for mis conduct, DA Happ no longer opposes the petition

The Court grants the petition for sentence adjustment

Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 16CF44, 16TR381, 16TR382 called together at 11:04am [mo]
Defendant Bradley J Grisham in court with Attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "  NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Grisham   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2 of Case 16CF44, Case 16TR381, and Case 16TR382.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Tania Strasburg,sister of Defendant makes a statement
Statement made by Mr. Grisham

The Court sentences Mr. Grisham   to 4 1/2   years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.  This sentence is consecutive to any previously imposed sentence

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--maintain absolute sobriety
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--random drug and alcohol screening
--maintan/obtain employment and/or education as deemed appropriate by agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay $1700 fine plus costs
--to pay $59.74 in blood testing costs
--not to operate a motor vehicle without valid DL and agent approval

The Court orders:
--36 month revocation of operating privlege
--36 month IID requirement
--6 demerit points
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
--attendance at victim impact panel
--provide DNA sample 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

The Court revokes bond 
recess: 11:30am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.

[MK] cases #16CF44, #16TR381, #16TR382 called at 11:16am. 
Defendant Bradley J Grisham in court with Attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases were scheduled for Plea Hearing today,  however Attorney Wilsnack cites the complex health status of Mr. Grisham and the need for Attorney Wilsnack to discuss arrangments for accomodating Mr. Grishamn's health needs and limitations during forthcoming incarceration with both the jail and the prison.  Attorney Wilsnack has just received a packet of awaited information that will assist him in discussing the necessary arrangments.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
The Court continues Bond. 
recess 11:19am. 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing in Case #16CF44 (and hearings to be set in the accompanying TR cases also) on 8/19/19 at 10:00am.
Plea hearing on July 25, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] cases #16CF44, #16TR381, #16TR382 called at 8:38am. 
Defendant Bradley Joseph Grisham in court with Attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court reviews the Preliminary Hearing Waiver form with the Defendant.  Attorney Wilsnack indicates he has discussed the right to Preliminary Hearing with Mr. Grisham.  Attorney Wilsnack voices his belief that Mr. Grisham understands "the ramifications of the Prelim and what he is going to be actually facing in the future".
Mr. Grisham's sister and caregiver, Tania Strasberg, provides a summary of Mr. Grisham's health issues.
Mr. Grisham waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
recess 8:50am. 
[clerk's added note:  when Attorney Wilsnack indicated to the clerk that he wants a plea-only hearing in July and that the Defense will be requesting a PSI, the clerk did clarify to Attorney Wilsnack that, upon the acceptance of the change of plea, there will be forthwith incarceration.]


NEXT:  schedule all three cases for Plea Hearing on 7/25/16 at 11:15am (JA- please not in Case 16CF44 comments that Defense intends to request PSI, but is aware that incarceration will be forthwith on that date)
of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cases 16CF44, 16TR381, 16TR382 called together at 3:20pm [mo]
Defendant Bradley Joseph Grisham in court with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Dahnert indicates that Mr. Grisham requests that his plea and sentencing be adjourned to July; further she indicates that Mr. Grisham requests a different attorney.
Atty. Dahnert indicates that she is SPD appointed.
The Court allows Attorney Dahnert to withdraw as counsel; directs SPD to appoint successor counsel. 
The Court directs Mr. Grisham to contact the SPD office 
Bail stands as fixed.

recess: 3:31pm

Case called at 2:49 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Bradley Joseph Grisham in court with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 2/29/16 at 1:30 pm.  
-No possession or consumption of alcohol
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 2:55 pm
